Debt-laden telecom operator Reliance Communications Ltd. today posted a consolidated loss for the fourth straight quarter.Net loss stood at Rs 2,709 crore in the quarter ended September compared to a profit of Rs 62 crore in the same period a year ago.Total income of the Anil Ambani-led firm declined by 48 percent to Rs 2,667 crore in the reported quarter from Rs 5,142 crore in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal.Reliance Communications, which is on the verge of shutting its voice call service, witnessed a decline in revenue from its both India and global operations. The India operations of the company recorded a loss before tax and financial cost of Rs 1,669 crore as compared to profit of Rs 611 crore during the same period a year ago.

The finance cost of the company, which is reeling under a debt of around Rs 45,000 crore, increased to Rs 1,149 crore during July-September 2017, as compared to Rs 825 crore a year ago.Shares of Reliance Communications on Friday closed at Rs 14.05 a unit, down 6.33 percent, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
title: Reliance Communications Posts Q2 Loss Of Rs 2,709 Crore
